item.title: Bayesian Data Analysis: Basics
item.author: Author
item.description: The three steps of Bayesian data analysis Setting up a full probability model—a joint probability distribution for all observable and unobservable quantities in a problem. Conditioning on observed data: calculating and interpreting the appropriate posterior distribution—the conditional probability distribution of the unobserved quantities of ultimate interest, given the observed data.
